## Bio

Freda Agyei-Dwarko is a medical doctor from Ghana and is currently pursuing a Master of Public Health degree at Johns Hopkins University, specializing in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, and Digital Health. As part of this training, she seeks to develop programming and data analysis skills by taking courses in statistical computing to better position herself for clinical research. With two years of clinical experience, she brings a strong foundation in patient care to her academic and research endeavors. Her primary interest lies in Interventional Radiology, where she seeks to integrate clinical expertise with data-driven insights to advance minimally invasive treatments and improve patient outcomes. Her current research focuses on this area, reflecting her aspiration to become an Interventional Radiologist and contribute to innovations in global health.
